item.title: [PI]Adding Dragon Claws Client Sided[PI]
item.dc:creator: @No_Life2 No Life
item.description:
@No_Life2 wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:2, topic:401717”]There’s more than that adding D claws,
And there’s more than just creating a folder called ‘Raw’
there’s code involved,& some galkons client’s use, a switch statement in ItemDef…[/quote]

As Extreme stated, this tutorial isn’t exactly very accurate. There are other factors to consider such as:

-Whether or not the "/* Hardcoded items start here */"comment exists in their PI client.
-Whether or not their client is slightly refactored in terms of renamed variables, arrays, etc.
-A couple more that are not necessary to list…

You should give a link to the client base that you used and work with that in your tutorial.

This is just constructive criticism. Don’t take it personally, I’m simply speaking from a newb’s point of view.

Overall quality of this guide (my opinion) 5.5/10

P.S. If you enjoy making tutorials, or want to become better at them, read up on some other one’s such as Ric’s web client tutorial. Although his tutorial doesn’t work for a lot of people…he did write out the tutorial VERY nicely.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Adding Dragon Claws Client Sided[PI]
item.dc:creator: @CorruptionX-Pk CorruptionX-Pk™
item.description:
@CorruptionX-Pk wrote:

This tutorial will show you how to add Dragon Claws into your Project Insanity client. It’s really easy. Credits to Galkon for the 474 look alike client.

First, download the models, you can find them here.

After downloading that, make a folder in your client, and name it Raw(If you already have this, then just skip this part)

Extract the models, and put them into your Raw folder, now open up ItemDef.java, and search

Right under that, add this int

if(i == 11740) { itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 44590; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt165 itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt200 itemDef.modelZoom = 789; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 240; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -23; itemDef.name = "Dragon claws"; itemDef.description = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); }
After adding that int, it should now look like this

/* Hardcoded items start here */ /**/ if(i == 11740) { itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 44590; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt165 itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt200 itemDef.modelZoom = 789; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 240; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -23; itemDef.name = "Dragon claws"; itemDef.description = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); } return itemDef; }
Save and Compile, and there you go. Now load up your client, and ingame type in add model, something should pop up asking you the model number, in there type 43660, then do it again, this time type 44590

Read full topic
